docs.lead_paragraph: THE brief stories on these pages tell of the progress made by the Hundred Neediest Cases of 1932 during the six months since the publication in THE NEW YORK TIMES last Christmas of the Twenty-first Annual Appeal.

headline.main: NO LONGER CAN THEY BE CALLED THE HUNDRED NEEDIEST; The Christmas Fund Given by the Readers of The New York Times Has Changed the Lives of Many Families in Distress NO LONGER CAN THEY BE CALLED THE HUNDRED NEEDIEST The Christmas Fund Given by the Readers of The New York Times Has Changed the Lives of Many Families in Distress

docs.lead_paragraph: IN JULY the well-kept flower garden offers a consolation and an assurance to the human world. The consolation consists of lovely sights and sweet odors. palliatives that take immediate effect against almost any mental pain.

headline.main: JULY'S GARDEN PAYS ROYAL DIVIDENDS IN BLOSSOMS; Its Borders, Reaching the Fullness of Luxuriant Growth, Overflow, and Delightful Fragrance Floods the Air JULY'S GARDEN PAYS DIVIDENDS

docs.abstract: Feature article on July blooms; illus
docs.snippet: IN JULY the well-kept flower garden offers a consolation and an assurance to the human world. The consolation consists of lovely sights and sweet odors. palliatives that take immediate effect against almost any mental pain.
